meanings.definition: To issue an order contrary to a previous order.
meanings.sent1: The general counterordered the retreat, deciding to stand their ground instead.
meanings.sent2: She counterordered the cancellation of the event, wanting to proceed as planned.
meanings.sent3: The teacher counterordered the homework submission deadline, causing confusion among the students.
meanings.sent4: His impulsive nature often led him to counterorder his own decisions, creating chaos.
meanings.sent5: The sudden change in weather counterordered our picnic plans, forcing us to stay indoors.

meanings.definition: An order issued in opposition to a previous order.
meanings.sent1: The new policy was a counterorder to the previous guidelines.
meanings.sent2: Receiving a counterorder from headquarters, the troops changed their course of action.
meanings.sent3: The counterorder to wear casual attire to the formal event left everyone puzzled.
meanings.sent4: Her decision to move out was a counterorder to her parents' wish for her to stay.
meanings.sent5: The counterorder to stop all production came as a shock to the factory workers.
